com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
    Enclosing class:
    SequenceSelection

    public static final class SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval
extends Object
implements XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
    A contiguous selection of residues in a sequence.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

        @Deprecated
public SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval(int fromResidue,
                                              int toResidue,
                                              SequenceDocument sequence)
        Deprecated. use #SelectionInterval(SequenceIndex, int, int) instead
        Parameters:
        fromResidue - 0-offset residue index where the interval starts, inclusive
        toResidue - residue 0-offset index where the interval finishes, exclusive - may be less than fromResidue for reverse direction
        sequence - the sequence in which the residues are selected, must not be null

      • SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

        public SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval(SequenceSelection.SequenceIndex sequenceIndex,
                                   int fromResidue,
                                   int toResidue)
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of the sequence in which the residues are selected.
        fromResidue - 0-offset residue index where the interval starts, inclusive
        toResidue - residue 0-offset index where the interval finishes, exclusive - may be less than fromResidue for reverse direction. May be Integer.MAX_VALUE to represent selecting the entire sequence. If Interval.getMaxExclusive() is greater than the sequence length, if a single sequence is selected which is circular then the selected is treated as wrapped back to the start of the sequence. in other cases the selection is truncated to the sequence length.
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

        public SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval(Interval residueInterval,
                                   Interval sequenceInterval,
                                   SequenceType sequenceType,
                                   SequenceSelection.SequenceDocumentType sequenceDocumentType)
        Constructs a rectangular selection (i.e. a range of sequences and a range of residues)
        Parameters:
        residueInterval - the range of residues. Interval.getMaxExclusive() may be Integer.MAX_VALUE to represent selecting the entire sequence. If Interval.getMaxExclusive() is greater than the sequence length, if a single sequence is selected which is circular then the selected is treated as wrapped back to the start of the sequence. in other cases the selection is truncated to the sequence length.
        sequenceInterval - the range of sequences
        sequenceType - the type of sequence (nucleotide or amino acid) selected
        sequenceDocumentType - the type of documents (aligned or unaligned) the sequences are selected in.
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

        @Deprecated
public SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval(Interval residueInterval,
                                              SequenceDocument sequence)
        Deprecated. use #SelectionInterval(SequenceIndex, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.utilities.Interval) instead
        Parameters:
        residueInterval - the residues selected for the given sequence. Interval.getMaxExclusive() may be Integer.MAX_VALUE to represent selecting the entire sequence
        sequence - the sequence in which the residues are selected, must not be null

      • SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval

        public SequenceSelection.SelectionInterval(SequenceSelection.SequenceIndex sequenceIndex,
                                   Interval residueInterval)
        Parameters:
        sequenceIndex - the index of the sequence in which the residues are selected. May be -1 for the consensus sequence (if it exists)
        residueInterval - the residues selected for the given sequence. Interval.getMaxExclusive() may be Integer.MAX_VALUE to represent selecting the entire sequence
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • getSequenceIndex

        public SequenceSelection.SequenceIndex getSequenceIndex()
        Returns the sequence index if this is a selection for a single sequence. This method should only be called on SelectionIntervals returned from SequenceSelection.getIntervals(true). For SelectionIntervals returned from getIntervals(false) use getSequencesRange() or getSequenceIndices() instead.
        Returns:
        the sequence index
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If this is a selection for multiple sequences (created via getIntervals(false))
        Since:
        API 4.40 (Geneious 5.4.0)

      • getSequenceIndices

        Since:

      • getMinResidue

        public int getMinResidue()
        Returns:
        the minimum residue index in the interval, inclusive

      • getMaxResidue

        public int getMaxResidue()
        Returns:
        the maximum residue index in the interval, exclusive (never less than minResidue). This may be Integer.MAX_VALUE to represent selecting the entire sequence

      • getResidueInterval

        public Interval getResidueInterval()
        Returns:
        the interval of selected residues. This interval may be [0,Integer.MAX_VALUE) to represent selecting the entire sequence

      • getVersionSupport

        public Geneious.MajorVersion getVersionSupport(XMLSerializable.VersionSupportType versionType)
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Gets either the latest version this class can serialize to via XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.toXML(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Geneious.MajorVersion, jebl.util.ProgressListener) or the most recent version in which the XML returned from XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible.toXML(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Geneious.MajorVersion, jebl.util.ProgressListener) last changed.
        Specified by:
        getVersionSupport in interface XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Parameters:
        versionType - specifies which version property to return
        Returns:
        the major version of Geneious corresponding to the versionType for this classes toXML method.

      • toXML

        public org.jdom.Element toXML(Geneious.MajorVersion version,
                     ProgressListener progressListener)
        Description copied from interface: XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Serializes this class to XML format, potentially to a format readable by an earlier version of Geneious. It is acceptable for the XML to include unnecessary tags that will be ignored by the earlier version. For example if the implementation has only extended the XML since the earlier version, then the XML returned may be identical to the XML returned for the current version.

        See XMLSerializable.toXML() for a more detailed description of what it means to serialize to XML.

        All classes that implement this method must also implement XMLSerializable.toXML() and should delegate back to this method using Geneious.getMajorVersion() and ProgressListener.EMPTY as parameters.

        Specified by:
        toXML in interface XMLSerializable.OldVersionCompatible
        Parameters:
        version - the major version of Geneious to serialize to XML for. For example "6.0" but not "6.0.0". This must be a version returned greater or equal to a version returned from getVersionSupport(VersionSupportType.OldestVersionSerializableTo) and must never be greater than the current version (Geneious.getMajorVersion())
        progressListener - for reporting progress and cancelling
        Returns:
        object encoded as a JDOM element
